revised_title: Geometrical Inversion in Organic Compounds: A Photochemical Study
tldr: The authors investigated the photochemical change in various pairs of geometrical isomers, such as maleic-fumaric and citraconic-mesaconic acids, under the influence of light. They found that the change produced in these solutions was never greater than 4%, and the absorption spectra of these solutions showed only general absorption in the ultra-violet with small molecular coefficients. The study provides insights into the behavior of organic compounds when exposed to light and the efficiency of the photochemical change.
